intro: Guiraoa arvensis, commonly known as the field guiraoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
